answers.answer: Good Morning.Your pinds and needles sensations can be caused by many things.  One of the them that comes to mind, is diabetes.  Out of control blood glucose readings can cause these symtpoms.  Peripheral (sp) neuropathy comes to my mind.Can these be symtpoms of MS?  Yes.  But you would need much further testing to find out the cause.  Have you had a visit with a Neurologist?Try and have a GREAT DAY, dear heart.  Let me know if I can help you in any way, with some more information.  If you share some more about what is going on with your body, please repost and we will see what we can do about offering our opinions....We are not doctor's but try to help by the experiences we incur in our lives.  I hope that we can be of some help to you...in understanding what is going on.Heather
I bumped up a post for you to read, that may answer some of your questions.  It's a post from Quix, called MRI's, Symptoms....etc.Hope this helps...Heather

question: lve been suffering from pins and needles of recent and also sweaty feet. the pins and needles are mainly in my hands and arms but also in my feet at times and l also get numbness in fingers and toes etc. Is a sign of MS or not and if so what other major symptoms would l have? Please help.
title: pins and needles
